Introduction to covid19usa R package

Source: vignettes/covid19usa.Rmd
covid19usa.Rmd
library(covid19usa)
library(dplyr)
#>

library(tibble)

Getting Started: Launching the App

The Shiny web application can be launched with a single line of code:

launch_app()

What the App Does

The Datasets

The package retrieves Covid-19 datasets from The New York Times) and Covidtracking.com. These datasets are combined with the U.S map data to provide an interactive map and other data visualisations to allow users to explore Covid-19 cases across the U.S. Several interactive features are included to allow for a more personalised information with the ability to manoeuvre between dates and states across U.S.

The datasets can be retrieved with theses functions embedded in the package:

covid_us_states %>% tibble() 
#> # A tibble: 11,904 x 8
#>    date       state   fips  cases deaths population cases_per_hnd deaths_per_hnd

The combined spatial datasets can be retrieved with these functions:

create_map_data()

What the App Does

The Shiny App consists of two main tabs:

Tab 1: Comparing Confirmed Covid-19 Cases (per 100,000 Population) across U.S States

please

Tab 2: Positive Covid-19 Cases found via Covid-19 Testing
